```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(rnoaa)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(broom)
library(boot)
```

# Problem 2

## Download the data
```{r}
weather_df = 
  rnoaa::meteo_pull_monitors(
    c("USW00094728"),
    var = c("PRCP", "TMIN", "TMAX"), 
    date_min = "2022-01-01",
    date_max = "2022-12-31"
  ) |>
  mutate(
    name = recode(id, USW00094728 = "CentralPark_NY"),
    tmin = tmin / 10,
    tmax = tmax / 10
  ) |>
  select(name, id, everything())
```
## Define the bootstrap function
```{r}
bootstrap_analysis = function(data, indices) {
  sample_data = data[indices, ]
  fit = lm(tmax ~ tmin + PRCP, data = sample_data)
  
  glance_data = glance(fit)
  tidy_data = tidy(fit)

  r_squared = glance_data[["r.squared"]]
  log_beta_product = log(abs(tidy_data[2, "estimate"] * tidy_data[3, "estimate"]))

  return(c(r_squared, log_beta_product))
}
```

## Perform bootstrap
```{r}
set.seed(123)
results = boot(data = weather_df, statistic = bootstrap_analysis, R = 5000)
```

## Extract results
```{r}
r_squared_boot = results[["t"]][, 1]
log_beta_product_boot = results[["t"]][, 2]
```

## Plot the distributions
```{r}
ggplot() + 
  geom_density(aes(x = r_squared_boot), fill = "lightblue", alpha = 0.5) +
  labs(title = "Distribution of R Squared Bootstrap Estimates",
       x = "R Squared",
       y = "Density") +
  theme_minimal()

ggplot() + 
  geom_density(aes(x = log_beta_product_boot), fill = "pink", alpha = 0.5) +
  labs(title = "Distribution of Log Beta Product Bootstrap Estimates",
       x = "Log Beta Product",
       y = "Density") +
  theme_minimal()
```
